title: FBI offers $10K reward for tips about suspect in Dallas hairdresser's death
text:
FBI offers $10K reward for tips about suspect in Dallas hairdresser's death Filed under Crime at Get Daily Dallas News Headlines Sign Up Get Unlimited Digital Access Your first month is less than a dollar. $0.99 for first 4 weeks Subscribe Now 
The FBI is helping authorities searching for the man suspected of killing Pleasant Grove hairdresser Marisol Espinosa by offering up to $10,000 for information leading to his capture. 
Dallas police have issued a murder warrant for Espinosa's ex-boyfriend, Faustino Lara Valdez. Federal officials also obtained an arrest warrant against him, accusing Valdez of unlawful flight to avoid prosecution. 
Espinosa went missing on Dec. 29, 2015, after a fire damaged her home. She had moved in with Valdez, the father of two of her three children. 
Her remains were found more than two months later under a bridge on Dowdy Ferry Road in southeast Dallas. Espinosa's relatives immediately pointed fingers at Valdez, who they said had not been seen since Jan. 3, 2016. 
Authorities suspect Valdez, 35, may have fled to Mexico. He is considered armed and dangerous. 
Anyone with information can call the FBI at 1-800-225-5324 or send a tip online at www.tips.fbi.gov. People can also contact your local FBI office. View Comments
